alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 31 at 4:04AM EDT until April 01 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Choppy surf, a strong northward flowing longshore current, and a Moderate risk of dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Saint Lucie and Coastal Martin Counties. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. Choppy surf can knock you off your feet and make you even more susceptible to becoming caught in the seaward pull of a rip current. Entering the surf today is not advised.
